text: one of the largest literature reviews in
history in regards to Depression was
conducted a couple of months ago the
researchers looked over to data from 97
studies with over 120 000 participants
in total and found that all forms of
physical activity are up to 50 percent
more effective than traditional therapy
and medication that's huge news because
if you think about it whenever we see
people dealing with depression the
standard advice nowadays is to tell them
to go and speak with someone sure
exercise and eating healthy are
sometimes mentioned as well but it's
usually not the first thing we tell
people to do now I'm not saying therapy
and medication don't work they still do
but hey if there is another solution
that is technically free and now seems
to be 50 percent more effective than
this should be the very first thing that
we recommend people to do we should be
pushing people to work out and get some
exercise you know throughout the years
I've spent hundreds of hours talking to
people trying to talk them into feeling
better eventually I kind kind of
realized that we were going in circles
no matter what I would say even if I
could get them to feel better it would
usually only be for a fleeting moment
for essentially the length of the
conversation plus some on the other hand
exercise is very different when you work
out there are many biological changes
that happen within your body you're
flooded with feel-good neurotransmitters
that have effects that can last for
hours and even days after the workout
it's like Nature's version of a drug
that's natural that's actually good for
you with basically no side effects
that's also free that now turns out to
be 50 percent more effective than the
drugs the therapist prescribes to you
for your depression and according to
this study it doesn't have to be crazy
full body workouts they found that all
types of physical activity could be
beneficial so that means just going out
for a walk every day instead of staying
at home all day could help you with your
depression but of course I recommend
some more intense forms of exercise such
as lifting weights swimming or going for
a run and that's it I just wanted to let
you you know that you should be asking
yourself if you're getting any exercise
if you've been feeling down in the dumps
instead of thinking that therapy and
medication are the only answers and just
a disclaimer this study focused on
participants with mild to medium levels
of depression if you are someone with
severe depression it is still best to
speak with someone first sticking to a
habit of exercise when you're in a rut
can be hard but there are ways that you
